doc: It seems that SWF files are not cached properly in NW so though the server returns the proper headers, a new request is always issue (200 response, rather than 200 (cached) or 304).
I've created a very basic demo that showcases the problem. The zip files can be download here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_R2Y-rDlXfVakNUZWVfdjdNbTQ

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1430418-caching-issue-with-flash-files?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F51989&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F51989&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
